intro: Floscopa elliottii, commonly known as Elliott's floscopa, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
